title: Strengthening e-Learning Practical Skills: Central Nervous System Anatomy: Simulation-Based Advanced Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary human anatomy knowledge and basic neurophysiological concepts
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Accurately identify and explain the major structures of the central nervous system (brain, spinal cord, neural pathways) in a 3D simulation environment.
Analyze neural transmission pathways and lesion impacts with 85% or higher accuracy in VR simulation-based scenarios.
Apply learned anatomical knowledge to analyze societal issues related to the nervous system (e.g., traumatic brain injury cases) and write a report.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
